content:
I presume you're referring to Cards View, and by 'object' you mean 'Subject', so try this: 

/* bold sender in card view */ .thread-card-container :is(.sender){ 	font-weight: bold !important; 	color: blue !important; 	font-size: 12pt !important; }  /* indent card subject */ .thread-card-subject-container :is(.subject){ 	margin-left: 10px !important; 	font-size: 10pt !important; }


Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the numbers and colour as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video on how to create a css file (Firefox and TB)

The above code includes an indent for the Subject and colour for the sender. The attached picture shows additional zebra striping and border lines.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Correction to above: noting that you want to modify only unread messages, instead of all messages, try this: 

tr[is="thread-card"][data-properties~="unread"] :is(.sender) {       color: orange !important;       font-weight: bold !important;       font-size: 12pt !important;    }  tr[is="thread-card"][data-properties~="unread"] :is(.subject) {       font-size: 10pt !important;       font-weight: normal !important;    }


The picture shows the original code plus the new code for unread messages.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Hello, it's great to hear that you've been using Thunderbird for such a long time! I understand that you've encountered an issue with the new version 115.4.1 (32-Bit) of Mozilla Thunderbird, where the focus is not on the last-read mail when reopening a mailbox. This can indeed be frustrating as it disrupts your workflow.

To address this issue, there are a few things you can try:

Check for Updates: First, make sure that you are using the latest version of Thunderbird. Sometimes, updates come with bug fixes and improvements. Visit the official Mozilla Thunderbird website to ensure you have the most recent version: Mozilla Thunderbird Download...., ,

Reset Preferences Reset Preferences: If updating doesn't resolve the issue, you can try resetting Thunderbird's preferences. This can often help with quirky behavior. Please be cautious and back up your important data before proceeding. Instructions for resetting preferences can be found on the official Mozilla support page: Resetting preferences.

Add-ons and Extensions: Sometimes, conflicts with add-ons or extensions can cause unexpected behavior. Disable your extensions one by one to see if any of them are causing the issue.

Provide Feedback: It's also a good idea to report this issue to Mozilla. Your feedback can help them identify and resolve the problem in future updates. You can provide feedback here: Mozilla Thunderbird Feedback Mozilla Thunderbird Feedback.

I hope these suggestions help you resolve the focus issue you're experiencing in Thunderbird. If you need further assistance or have more questions, feel free to ask.
creator: theskillsup

content: if thunderbird is on both PCs, try this - exit thunderbird from both - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to a USB stick - on new pc, copy to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming - you will be prompted for overwrites. Allow - start TB on new PC and all accounts should be there.
creator: davidsk

content:
Are you using Unified Folders? Is gmail's "All Mail" folder displayed?

Also

  • Please start *Windows* in safe mode with networking enabled https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode
  • Still in Windows safe mode, start Thunderbird in Troubleshoot mode https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

Does problem go away?
creator: wsmwk

content:
There is a mailto: protocol that is used and windows has to have it set all special like. The default mail client is not good enough. There are however also settings in the browser that need to be set up for links on web sites. The mailto setup for windows is only for mailto links from desktop apps.

A google search turned up these instructions which appear fairly comprehensive. https://www.makeuseof.com/tag/how-to-change-the-default-email-program-for-mailto-links
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Thank you for your response, Wayne Mery.

To address your questions:

'YES:' I am using Unified Folders.

'YES:' Gmail's ALL MAIL Folder is displayed; however, it is not part of the unified folders. It can be seen and accessed via the individual account, located below the Unified Folders. For example:

Account 1: 

   Inbox    Drafts    All Mail    Trash    Etc., etc.

And, yes, when I start Win10 in safe mode (with Networking) and TB in troubleshooting mode, the problem disappears. However, the unified folders also disappear, so I need to check each inbox individually.

I'm wondering whether the issue is with the unified folders or the ALL Mail (which I never use). As mentioned in my original post, I have the same accounts set up on 5 PCs, and the problem is happening on 3 of the 5 PCs.

On one of the PCs, I cannot click on the unified inbox without a guaranteed HANG, so we just check each account individually.

Again, I appreciate your time and assistance.
